Summary:

Sells/leases new- and used-vehicles at dealership gross profit, volume, and customer satisfaction standards.

Essential Duties:

Satisfies the transportation needs of vehicle purchasers.

Sells/leases and delivers the required minimum number of units per month, after initial training.

Approaches, greets, and offers assistance or direction to any customer who enters the dealership showroom or sales lot.

Assists customers in selecting a vehicle by asking questions and listening carefully to their responses.

Explains fully product performance, application, and benefits to prospects.

Describes all optional equipment available for customer purchase.

Offers test drives to all prospects. Follows dealership procedure to obtain proper identification from customer prior to test drive.

Utilizes dealership sales control and follow-up system.

Exhibits high level of commitment to customer satisfaction.

Knows and understands the federal, state, and local laws which govern retail automobile sales.

Establishes personal income goals that are consistent with dealership standards of productivity, and devises a strategy to meet those goals.

Attends product and sales training courses as requested by sales manager.

Keeps abreast of new products, features, accessories, etc., and their benefits to customers.

Knows and understands equity and values, and is able to explain depreciation to the customer.

Ensures that the sales manager has an opportunity to meet each customer.

Turns 100 percent of closed deals to finance and insurance manager, along with properly completed paperwork (insurance information, trade title, etc.).

Writes complete sales orders and processes paperwork in accordance with established dealership policies.

Prepares sold vehicles for customer delivery prior to customer arrival.

Delivers vehicles to customers, ensuring that the customer understands the vehicle's operating features, warranty, and paperwork.

Introduces customers to service department personnel to emphasize to them the quality and efficiency of service repairs and maintenance available in the dealership's service department.

Schedules first service appointment.

Follows up on all post delivery items, and special requests to be sure that all customer expectations are met.

Maintains an owner follow-up system that encourages repeat and referral business and contributes to customer satisfaction.

Maintains a prospect development system.

Reviews and analyzes actions at the end of each day, week, month, and year to determine how to better utilize time and plans more effectively.

Attends sales meetings.

Maintains professional appearance.

Responsible for dealer trades, both pick-up and delivery.

Responds to all pages in a timely manner.

Attends all training and sales meetings.

Punjabi speaking would be an asset

job.positionTitle: Licensed Technicians - Downtown Ford & Downtown Hyundai
job.detail:
Downtown Automotive Group represents a number of the most recognized and respected brands in the automotive industry. Founded in 1992, our team has grown to more than 300 employees across our head office and 10 retail locations. DAG has been an active member of the downtown Toronto community from day one and we operate with the vision that people are our most important asset and the foundation of our success. Early next year, DAG will launch the first multi-branded, multi-purpose automotive/residential complex in downtown Toronto – The “Autoplex” – which will be the new home for seven Downtown brands: Ford, Genesis, Hyundai, Infiniti, Lincoln, Nissan, and Toyota. Lexus Downtown, Toyota on Front and Avenue Nissan are also proud members of DAG. It’s an exciting time for our company!

We have busy and growing service departments at Downtown Ford & Downtown Hyundai and are looking for Technicians (both flat rate Licensed and 3rd/4th year Apprentices). The ideal candidates will have the following:

- Ontario Mechanic's License (310S) in good standing (for Licensed Techs).

- Brand experience preferred. If not, we will train the right candidates!

- Proven record of quality and efficient workmanship.

- Ability to work as part of a high performance team.

- Positive attitude with a drive to succeed.

- Strong commitment to customer satisfaction.

- Strong aptitude of technical/mechanical repairs.

- Good computer and time management skills.

- Organizational ability and attention to detail.

- A valid driver's license (with clean abstract).

If you are able to deliver strong customer satisfaction consistently, are motivated and a great teammate, we are interested in speaking with you!

We offer a competitive compensation package including medical/dental benefits, an employee purchase program, team atmosphere, management support and ongoing training, as well as opportunities for career development and advancement within the group.

DAG is committed to an inclusive and accessible workplace. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

How would you like to work with one of Canada's most prestigious and well respected automotive groups? Join Auto World Imports Network!

Headquartered in Thornhill Ontario, we are a premier network of 15 luxury automobile dealerships in the Greater Toronto Area, as well as we own 3 state of the art collision centres.

Our company values customers and employees and has invested in principles for success that is only achieved by doing business with integrity and the highest ethical standard.

Due to our continued growth one of our Honda Downtown dealership is looking for a Pre-owned Sales Manager to join our amazing team!

We offer competitive salaries and generous benefits!

Benefits

  • Competitive salary
  • Excellent Group Benefits package.
  • Group RRSP Contribution program.
  • Work/life balance.
  • Training and support programs.
  • Boot and tool allowance.
  • Tuition reimbursement program.
  • Corporate support.
  • Mentorship and development.
  • Unlimited careers opportunities within our automotive group.

Job Purpose

Responsible for the sales of all Pre-Owned vehicles, the profitability of the department and will assume responsibility for evaluating, purchasing, reconditioning, displaying and marketing the Pre-Owned vehicle inventory.

Core Accountabilities

  • Prepare monthly and annual department objectives for the sales, gross turnover and expenses of the Pre-Owned sales department.
  • Follow up on all potential buyers, by creating, implementing and closely monitoring a customer search and sales control system.
  • Provide his/her supervisor with exact information on management of floor activities, on a daily basis.
  • Manage the marketing and advertising activities.
  • Complete transaction sheets and forwards them to accounting.
  • Establish and maintain standards for the delivery of vehicles to the customers.
  • Process the Sales Consultants commission sheets.
  • Evaluate incoming Pre-Owned vehicles, ensuring that title of ownership and mechanical condition and bodywork are all in order.
  • Ensure that vehicles intended for the retail market are covered by a legal warranty.
  • Plan and manage the display of vehicles in the parking area.
  • Understand and keep abreast of federal and provincial regulations and municipal bylaws governing the sale of Pre-Owned vehicles.
  • Keep abreast of the manufacturer’s current product, program and promotional events, and/or those of the financial institutions. Notify the sales team of any changes.
  • Follow market trends as a basis for deciding which vehicles to stock.
  • Source quality vehicles as a result of monitoring newspapers or other publications advertising.
  • Implement, and direct a turnover policy of 45 days.
  • Perform dealer trades as required.
  • Manage the Pre-Owned vehicles reconditioning procedures, ensuring that it doesn’t exceed forecasts.
  • Create and maintain a network of wholesale and retail Sales Consultants to whom we would purchase and sell vehicles.
  • Attend the vehicle auction as approved and required by the General Manager.
  • Closely monitor GP from auction purchases, and compare it to GP from trade-ins.
  • Develop and manage wholesale activities.
  • Direct and assist Sales Consultants in the setting of aggressive, but realistic, monthly objectives.
  • Provide the Sales Consultants with support.
  • Monitor Sales Consultant’s activities to ensure that we achieve high CSI results.
  • Encourage departmental team work.
  • Maintain good communications with the New Vehicle department, as well as other departments.
  • Performs other tasks, based on management requirements and instructions.

Requirements

  • High school diploma or equivalent.
  • Automotive industry experience.
  • Minimum of 1 - 3 years of previous management experience in the automotive industry.
  • Valid Ontario G Driver’s Licence.
  • Clear Driver’s Abstract.
  • Valid OMVIC registration.
  • Strong business acumen.
  • Professional appearance.
  • Proficient with 180, CDK and Reynolds systems; ability to operate PC-based software.
  • Ability to sell the minimum quota according to dealership objective
  • Excellent communication skills: verbal and written.
  • Excellent customer service skills.

Personal Attributes

  • Passion, motivation, focus and leadership skills.
  • Results focused approach.
  • Team player.
  • Strong communication skills: both written, verbal and listening.
  • Ability to influence, negotiate and mediate effectively.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality and professionalism.
  • Excellent interpersonal and team building skills.
  • Strong time management and organizational skills.
  • Honest, courteous and able to demonstrate strong work ethics.
  • Driven and ability to work with minimum supervision.

Working Conditions

The Pre-Owned Sales Manager works both indoors and outdoors, moving about the dealership facility and lot to communicate with Sales Consultants and customers. This person works closely with the New Vehicle department and the Finance & Insurance Department to transport paperwork and to discuss sales. Weekend, evening, and holiday hours will be required. May go on test drives.

The Director of Sales (DOS) reporting to the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of Setay Inc. is responsible for managing the company’s new and used sales departments. The DOS is an effective communicator, has strong leadership skills, is highly visible and engaging, and works closely with the sales managers and their respective teams, including the business offices and the sales BDCs. The DOS is highly focused on the sales process, inventory management, customer service, strategic marketing, and the company’s sales objectives. The DOS provides the coaching, training, and necessary resource to support the sales departments and benchmarks their progress through formal methods (detailed analysis and performance measurement reports) and informal methods (management walk arounds). The DOS collaborates with the CEO and the Directors of Marketing, Inventory, and Leasing in order to help achieve the company’s sales objectives.

Major Areas of Responsibility

  • Sales, New and Used as well as the Business Managers (F&I) are directly supervised and supported by the DOS.
  • In conjunction with the CEO meets with the manufacturers’ district sales managers and/or financial representatives on a regular basis and attends all manufacturers’ meetings.
  • Works closely with the Director of Marketing to ensure the new and used vehicles are being appropriately represented.
  • In calibration with the Director of Inventory and Sales managers to ensure the proper used vehicle stocking levels and mix on the dealerships’ used vehicle lots.
  • Works with the Business Development Centre Appointment Coordinator of each dealership to ensure effective follow up.
  • Monitor the daily activity and performance of the organizations’ new and used vehicle sales departments including the business office and sales managers to ensure proper processes are being upheld and preset goals are being achieved.
  • Establishes a comprehensive and consistent training program for existing and new sales representatives.
  • Promotes teamwork and reinforces cooperation among team members and employees in all departments.
  • Ensure all company and industry standards and procedures are upheld by all reports.

Performance Criteria

  • Sales Volume and Gross Profit
  • Expense control
  • Achievement of departments’ annual forecasted net profit
  • Effective management of the sales managers
  • High customer service ratings
  • Inventory management

Qualifications

  • Proven leadership ability
  • Functions in a team-based environment
  • 5-10 years automotive management experience
  • Solid sales, financial, marketing (digital) and administrative background
  • Solid understanding of the retail vehicle market
  • University or college degree in a related discipline
  • Valid Ontario Drivers and OMVIC license

Accomadation in the hiring process is avaiable upon request.

An Automotive Detailer provides prompt and effective services to the client, maintains the tools and products that are used and diligently follows the instructions their employer. In the execution of this position, an automotive detailer is required to observe all safety measures that are necessary. The most essential qualification of a car detailer is their ability to learn from others and their own experiences.

Responsibilities

  • Responsible for the detailing of interior and exterior of cars, for both company and customer vehicles, and recently purchased used vehicles.
  • Perform general car detailing activities, including, vacuuming, shampooing, deodorizing, washing and waxing.
  • Ensure the exterior of cars are clean and smudge free
  • Clean and polish vehicle windows.
  • Wash car interiors including the upholstery, apply leather cleaning products, removing and cleaning floor mats. Apply stain guard.
  • Apply polish to remove scraps.
  • Clean and polish wheels and rims.
  • Use cloths, squeegees, or air compressors to dry surfaces of vehicles.
  • Drive vehicles to or from company’s garage, rotate cars in dealership lot and picks up/drop off cars for customers.
  • Mix cleaning solutions, abrasive compositions, or other compounds/solutions, according to formulas.
  • Clean, remove, scrap and shovel snow from cars.
  • Operate cleaning equipment, or machines.
  • Use a variety of hand held tools to detail the interior and exterior of cars.
  • Notify supervisor or appropriate technician when you notice parts of car that require repair or replacement.
  • Performs other repair duties as required.

Requirements

  • High school diploma or GED.
  • Interest in cars, and knowledgeable about car repair and maintenance.

What We Offer

  • Competitive compensation plan of salary and bonus
  • Company group benefit after 3 months of employment

In accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities, a request for accommodation will be accepted throughout the hiring process.

We are an equal opportunity employer that welcomes all applicants including persons with disabilities, visible minorities, women, and aboriginals. We thank you for your interest, however, only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

Reporting to the General Manager, the Pre-Owned Inventory Manager’s role is to direct all activities related to the sale of used vehicles, both Volkswagen and non-Volkswagen products, to achieve vehicle sales volume and profit objectives. These activities include the procurement (wholesale), preparation and retail sale of vehicles as described and corresponding with the Volkswagen, Leavens Volkswagen, and MTO standards.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Deliver Value for the Customer
Establishes and maintains good working relationships with customers to encourage repeat and referral business.
Ensures that customer complaints are handled tactfully, promptly, with genuine concern, and according to the dealership’s guidelines; works closely with the customer to settle disputes brought about by complaints as needed.
Takes the initiative to exceed customer satisfaction, even if it requires overcoming obstacles.
Ensures that each and every customer encounter is consistent with the Leavens Customer First philosophies.
Flexes availability in order to assist customers in parts, sales, or service areas.
Monitor, track and approve reconditioning of pre-owned vehicles to maintain high level of quality while managing and controlling reconditioning costs.
Ensure all websites are accurate and up to date with detailed vehicle descriptions, industry class pictures and videos.
Guarantees that used cars are treated and displayed in the most functional and aesthetic way possible, including parked in proper spaces with up to date pricing in vehicle window, free of snow and clean, inside and out, at all times.
Ensures the quality of used vehicles by appraising, purchasing, reconditioning, displaying and merchandising used vehicle inventory.
Is familiar with all sales administration systems in order to provide support when required.
Identifies, recommends, and supports opportunities for methods/process improvement.

Develop Top Talent
Develops a team atmosphere within the department.
Communicates regularly with the sales staff.
Assists salespeople in closing deals, if requested by sales managers.
Communicates departmental goals and objectives to ensure understanding of job expectations and requirements.
Ensures salespeople are informed of all new inventory and current advertising programs, including updating and supplying used car inventory list.
Delegates work as needed to ensure customer satisfaction while developing employee skills.
Ensures a positive and safe working environment for employees.
Maintains high ethical standards at all times.
Works in collaboration with sales managers.
Builds productive working relationships and consults with others as necessary.
Has an approachable style; fosters open communication through active listening; listens actively to understand others completely.
Resolves all employee concerns in a prompt and effective manner; resolves internal conflicts among employees in the department; resolves all disputes and difficulties with professionalism and composure.
Attends and participates in manager meetings as requested.

Develop Business Strategy
Establishes knowledge base of auto industry competition.
Keeps up-to-date on all information pertinent (e.g., dealership policies and procedures) to the Pre-Owned Manager position.
Has a full understanding of sales trends along with the use of local market intelligence in conjunction with allocation and product constraints necessary.
Maintains active professional affiliations and certifications.
Pursues all available methods of inventory acquisitions including auctions, private sale purchases.
Daily monitoring of trade appraisals with the prospect of saving a deal.
Monitoring pricing in vAuto including inventory analysis, re-pricing and bucket jumpers.
Track and log inventory and provide weekly reports including profits, losses on retail and wholesale deals, VDP, aging of inventory, and any potential inventory concerns.
Detailed tracking of used cars to have information to ascertain reasons for losses, use data with future acquisitions to prevent losses.
Responsible for other duties as assigned and/or required by business need.

REQUIRED COMPETENCIES

Has a strong aptitude for logical thinking, including detailed problem-solving skills.
Desires to build long-lasting and trusting customer relationships.
Holds an active interest in automobiles and the Volkswagen brand in particular.
Understands the intricacies of the wholesale vehicle market.
Bachelor’s degree in business management or similar field (or equivalent experience
Merchandise or inventory management experience, preferably in automotive retail or automotive-related industry
Retail management experience
Valid driver's license

What we offer:

A very competitive pay plan with high earning potential
An incredible opportunity for advancement within the organization. With 5 dealerships in the Group, opportunities are available
A leadership team that trains and mentors its staff to ensure the success of new members
Fun performance based environment
Newly built, clean and modern facility
Workout room with lockers and showers
Long weekends off in the summer!

We also offer a great compensation package, and a Group Benefit program which includes Health & Dental, LTD, EAP, Employee "Perk" program, Trip Cancellation/Out of Province Insurance and Retirement Savings Plan!

Please submit a resume including email address & cover letter stating what attracts you to this position, and what motivates you in order to be considered. We appreciate all who apply; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Leavens Volkswagen is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require accommodation for disability during any stage of the recruitment process, please indicate this in your cover letter (or email).

job.detail:
We are currently looking for a motivated individual who is focused on customer service and satisfaction to join our parts department.

POSITION SUMMARY

Sells parts to all customers, over the counter, through the shop, or on the phone.

PROSPECT AND CUSTOMER REPONSIBILITIES

To provide each and every prospect or customer who arrives on the premises an exceptionally positive experience.
To make each prospect and customer feel welcome and provide a relaxed yet professional atmosphere.
To have each and every prospect and customer who walks out of our store, or drives off our lot, say to themselves (and others) “I wish every dealership shopping and buying experience was like this.”

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Fulfilling all internal, wholesale, and retail customer’s parts orders or providing quotes.
Maintaining an ordered parts department and finding parts from stock.
Advising customers of parts needs.

SPECIFIC DUTIES (plus any other duties as assigned)

Assists all customers (retail and shop) in selecting required parts in a friendly, professional, and efficient manner.
Informs customers of companion part requirements and specials, and ensures that the customer is exposed to the full product line.
Answers phone calls, providing price quotes and other information.
Reviews body shop estimates to be sure the parts that are ordered are correct and all pricing is in line with the estimate.
Provides high level of service to internal and external customers.
Pulls and fills orders from stock.
Notifies parts manager of out-of-stock parts or shop materials that need immediate attention.
Locates out-of-stock parts from outside source and submits an emergency order, if necessary.
Notifies the service advisor and the customer when special ordered parts have been received.
Notifies the body shop when all parts have arrived and when they will be delivered.
Pulls orders for delivery to body shop, making sure all parts are tagged with customer names and job number.
Follows up on back-ordered parts.
Verifies will-call and back-order files weekly and returns to vendors, or stocks those items not picked up or required.
Replenishes assigned inventory daily.
Assists outside sales representatives with their orders.
Makes sure all internal requests for parts are billed on service repair order.
Receives payment from retail customers or obtains credit authorization.
Ensures that all charge sales are signed by the customer.
Ensures that all customers receive their copy of the invoice.
Issues credit for parts returned, ensuring that the original invoice, or its number, is available so that purchase and pricing can be verified.
Keeps orderly records of all repair orders, invoices, insurance estimates, and special order parts.
Sets up orders for daily shipment, delivery, or pick-up.
Solicits assigned accounts by phone.
Keeps front and rear counter areas clean and uncluttered.
Participates in all training programs that are made available.
Keeps current on new products and product updates.
Participates with the parts manager in maintaining a lost sales tracking program.
Maintains professional appearance.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Possess a valid driver’s license
Strong social skills.
Excellent communicator
Growth mindset.
Goal focused
Able to be 100% committed and loyal to the store Vision
Able to handle the responsibility of the role within the defined parameters

We offer a generous compensation and benefits package. A great working environment plus the chance to grow with a brand that is becoming one of the hottest brands in the industry. How would you like to work with one of Canada's most prestigious and well respected automotive groups? Join Auto World Imports Network!

Headquartered in Thornhill Ontario, we are a premier network of 15 luxury automobile dealerships in the Greater Toronto Area, as well as we own 3 state of the art collision centres.

Our company values customers and employees and has invested in principles for success that is only achieved by doing business with integrity and the highest ethical standard.

Due to our continued growth, AWIN Advanced Auto Body Centre is looking for a Body Shop Manager to join our amazing team!

We offer competitive salaries and generous benefits!

Benefits

  • Excellent Group Benefits package.
  • Group RRSP Contribution program.
  • Work/life balance.
  • Training and support programs.
  • Tuition reimbursement program.
  • Corporate support.
  • Mentorship and development.
  • Unlimited careers opportunities within our automotive group.

Job Purpose

This position is responsible for directing the work activities of the collision centre employees, including their observance of deadlines and productivity levels, as well as the maintenance of quality standards. The Body Shop Manager achieves a reasonable operating profit for the department and maintains customer satisfaction standards, while being mindful of expenses. Responsibilities also include prospecting new business to ensure a profitable sales volume.

Core Accountabilities

  • Establishes objectives for the department with the General Manager and attains these objectives.
  • Prepares and manages the annual operating budget of the collision centre.
  • Implements a dynamic marketing plan with the intent of increasing collision centre sales.
  • Maintains efficient communications within the department as well as between departments.
  • Endeavors to promote harmony and a team spirit with all the other departments.

Tasks related to Customer Service and Relationships with Insurers

  • Builds and maintains good working relationships with insurance adjusters.
  • Negotiates with insurance company representatives.
  • Completes insurance forms, indicating the estimated repair costs and making recommendations.
  • Obtains the insurer’s approval and agreement to the estimates.
  • Builds and maintains good relations with the customers, to encourage their loyalty and obtain their recommendations.
  • Welcomes arriving customers in a friendly and professional manner.
  • Answers telephone calls, or ensures that they are answered quickly and in a polite and professional manner.
  • Provides a high quality repair service and reduces returns to the shop.
  • Handles customer complaints as soon as possible according to the dealer’s instructions.

Tasks related to Damage Evaluation

  • Examines damaged vehicles to determine the degree of structural and mechanical damage, as well as damage to the bodywork and the insides of the vehicles.
  • Evaluates the cost of labour and parts to repair or replace each damaged part.
  • Reviews repair cost estimates with the collision centre foreman.
  • Weighs the feasibility of repairs against the replacement of parts such as bumpers, fenders and doors.
  • Evaluates the cost of repainting undamaged vehicles (retail repairs), converting them to specific uses or customizing them.
  • Uses the Shoplink/Photolink/Mitchell System efficiently to prepare the estimates.

Tasks related to Administrative Follow-up

  • Checks how work on the vehicles in the shop is progressing, and ensures that guidelines concerning repairs and safety are observed.
  • Verifies the quality of the completed work.
  • Follows up on orders sent to the parts department, to ensure that the parts are available.
  • Verifies the technicians’ productivity reports and the corresponding pay sheets every day.
  • Verifies the documents circulating and ensures that they are all entered, duly completed, legible and filed or sent to the individuals concerned.
  • Verifies and follows up on collision centre customer accounts, to ensure that payments take place within an acceptable time frame.
  • For warranty work, follows the appropriate procedures.
  • Ensures that the appropriate safety equipment is available and that it is being adequately used.

Tasks related to the Management of Human Resources

  • Conducts formal evaluations of the performance of personnel direct reports at set intervals.
  • Motivates the personnel and participates in hiring the personnel, jointly with his/her supervisor.
  • Encourages employees and/or provides them with technical training and refers them to appropriate training schools, as necessary.
  • Manages and draws up the work plan for all collision centre employees.
  • Encourages team work in an environment focused on customer service.
  • Keeps abreast of available equipment and new tools and recommends purchases.
  • Monitors maintenance of the paint booths, the frame straightening material and other fixed assets, to ensure their longevity and long-term value.
  • Sees to the cleanliness of the work spaces and customer waiting rooms.
  • Understands, keeps abreast of and observes federal and provincial regulations and municipal bylaws governing collision centre operations and occupational health and safety.
  • Takes part in management meetings.
  • Maintains a professional appearance.
  • Performs other tasks, based on management requirements and instructions.

Requirements

  • High school diploma or equivalent.
  • Background in the collision industry is required.
  • Previous Body Shop Manager Experience.
  • Knowledge of vehicle functionalities.
  • Valid Ontario G Driver’s Licence.
  • Clear Driver’s Abstract.
  • Strong business acumen.
  • Professional appearance.
  • Proficient with Mitchell on Demand, Audatex, CDK and ability to operate PC-based software.
  • Excellent communication skills: verbal and written.
  • Excellent customer service skills.

Personal Attributes

  • Passion, motivation, focus and leadership skills.
  • Results focused approach.
  • Team player.
  • Strong communication skills both written and verbal.
  • Ability to influence, negotiate and mediate effectively.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality and professionalism.
  • Excellent interpersonal and team building skills.
  • Strong time management and organizational skills.
  • Honest, courteous and able to demonstrate strong work ethics.
  • Driven and ability to work with minimum supervision.

Working Conditions

  • Walking about the dealership.
  • Bending, stretching, lifting and reaching.
  • Using physical and manual dexterity.
  • Using computers to look up and enter data.
  • Using equipment consistent with industry standards.
  • Driving a vehicle.

Exposed to noise, vibrations, dust, rust, exhaust fumes, and a variety of other hazardous and non-hazardous materials.

APPLY FOR A REWARDING CAREER TODAY!

AWIN is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require accommodation during any stage of the recruitment process, please indicate this in your cover letter (or email).

How would you like to work with one of Canada's most prestigious and well respected automotive groups? Join Auto World Imports Network!

Headquartered in Thornhill Ontario, we are a premier network of 15 luxury automobile dealerships in the Greater Toronto Area, as well as we own 3 state of the art collision centres.

Our company values customers and employees and has invested in principles for success that is only achieved by doing business with integrity and the highest ethical standard.

Due to our continued growth, our Volkswagen Villa, luxury dealership is looking for an experienced Licensed Technician to join our amazing team!

Benefits

  • 3 months guarantee
  • Competitive salary
  • Excellent Group Benefits package.
  • Group RRSP Contribution program.
  • Work/life balance.
  • Training and support programs.
  • Boot and tool allowance.
  • Tuition reimbursement program.
  • Corporate support.
  • Mentorship and development.
  • Unlimited careers opportunities within our automotive group.

Job Purpose

The Licensed Automotive Service Technician inspects, maintains and repairs vehicles that run on electricity, gasoline, or alternative fuels such as diesel, following manufacturers’ processes and procedures. This position will perform duties which encompass tire rotations and oil changes, diagnose complex problems and plan and execute vehicle repairs. This will involve completing all repairs correctly the first time, thereby avoiding possible comebacks or customer dissatisfaction. The individual may specializes in specific service areas.

Core Accountabilities

  • Detect and diagnose the vehicle problems as per the customer’s complaints.
  • Inspect and road testing recently delivered vehicles.
  • Remain informed on Federal and Provincial Regulations and Municipal bylaws. This may include laws governing the removal of hazardous waste, etc.; understand and observe all regulations and bylaws.
  • Notify the Service Consultant and the Shop Foreman if additional work is required, or if the repairs cannot be done by the expected deadline.
  • Ensure customer’s cars are clean and reporting any incidents that may affect the appearance or condition of a vehicle.
  • Attend all internal and external training courses sponsored by the manufacturer to remain up to date on manufacturer products (includes parts and vehicles).
  • Report any safety concerns to the supervisor immediately.
  • Perform the work described in work orders efficiently and accurately.
  • Test to check whether systems and components are secure and are working properly.
  • Isolate the systems or components that might have caused the issue.
  • Drive the vehicle for testing purposes or use various equipment including hand-held and onboard compression gauges, or diagnostic computers (this also includes road testing recently delivered vehicles).
  • Adjust, repair, or replace parts and components of automotive systems including fuel system, brakes, steering and suspension, engine and drive train, emission control and exhaust, cooling and climate control, and electrical and electronic systems using hand tools and other specialized automotive repair equipment.
  • Test and adjust repaired systems to manufacturer's performance specifications.
  • Inspect and test mechanical units, such as engines, transmissions, axles and brake systems, to locate faults and malfunctions.
  • Obtain parts from the Parts Department and return parts as required.
  • Report any defective or poorly functioning equipment to management.
  • Ensure customers’ vehicles are clean after repairs.
  • Report any incident which may affect the appearance or condition of a vehicle to the Service Consultant as soon as possible.
  • Supervise the work of the Apprentice Technicians as requested.
  • Maintain and ensure the shop is clean and tidy. This may include laws governing the removal of hazardous waste, etc.; understand and observe all regulations and bylaws.
  • Perform other tasks based on management requirements and instructions.

Requirements

  • High school diploma or equivalent.
  • Valid Ontario G Driver’s Licence.
  • Clear Driver’s Abstract.
  • Technicians Licence.
  • Ontario College of Trades membership.
  • Knowledge and use of power, machine, and hand tools.
  • Four years of direct work experience in automotive repairs and service.
  • Extensive knowledge of different vehicles and their service needs.
  • Ability to operate electronic diagnostic equipment.
  • Ability to effectively communicate automotive issues clearly.
  • Ability to work independently or as a team, managing his or her time and work flow.
  • Ability to drive manual transmission vehicles.

Personal Attributes

  • Passion, motivation, focus and leadership skills.
  • Results focused approach.
  • Team player.
  • Strong communication skills both written and verbal.
  • Ability to influence, negotiate and mediate effectively.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality and professionalism.
  • Excellent interpersonal and team building skills.
  • Strong time management and organizational skills.
  • Honest, courteous and able to demonstrate strong work ethics.
  • Driven and ability to work with minimum supervision.

Working Conditions

  • Bending, stretching, lifting, climbing, and reaching.
  • Standing six to eight hours during a shift.
  • Using physical and manual dexterity.
  • Using computers to look up and enter data.
  • Using equipment consistent with industry standards.
  • Spend time outdoors road testing vehicles.
  • Exposed to noise, vibrations, dust, rust, exhaust fumes, and a variety of other hazardous and non-hazardous materials.

APPLY FOR A REWARDING CAREER TODAY!

AWIN is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require accommodation during any stage of the recruitment process, please indicate this in your cover letter (or email).

Functions as a skilled-level technician who is able to perform diagnoses and repairs in all areas, in addition to being specialized in particular areas of repair.

Performs work as outlined on repair order with efficiency and accuracy, in accordance with dealership and factory standards.
Diagnoses cause of any malfunction and performs repair.
Communicates with parts department to obtain needed parts.
Saves and tags parts of the job if under warranty or if requested by the customer.
Ensures parts department signs-off as receiving warranty return parts on Repair Orders (Hard Copy)
Examines assigned vehicle to determine if further safety or service work is required or recommended.
Communicates with service advisor immediately if additional work is needed, if work outlined is not needed, or if repairs cannot be completed within the promised time.
Documents all work performed and recommended on the repair order, including an accurate and legible customer complaint, cause and correction as performed.
Returns repair orders at the end of the workday to the dispatch office.
Contacts technical hot lines to assist in diagnosis of unusual problems, after consulting with shop foreman.
Road tests vehicles before and after required repairs or refers to the shop foreman.
Participates in manufacturer-sponsored training programs, schools, and events.
Attends Dept. meetings and on-site factory training.
Keeps abreast and maintains file of manufacturer technical bulletins.
Supervises work of any apprentice technicians as assigned.
Reports machinery defects or malfunctions to supervisor.
Ensures that customers' cars are kept clean. Notifies service advisor immediately of anything that has happened to change the appearance or condition of the vehicle.
Keeps shop area neat and clean.
Maintains and is accountable for all dealership-owned tools and manuals. Returns them to the proper place and in the same condition as they were received.
Understands, keeps abreast of, and complies with federal, state, and local regulations, such as hazardous waste disposal, OSHA Right-to-Know, etc.
Operates all tools and equipment in a safe manner.
Reports any safety issues immediately to management.

Must be able to work evening and saturdays

Diesel skills would be an asset

Chrysler experience would be an asset

Everything begins with passion.  A passion for life, a passion for adventure and a passion for what you do.  Our Audi family is committed to excellence. This commitment stems from our knowledge and trust in the Audi brand. Our team takes great pride in providing all of our customers with the highest level of service. It is our customers that drive us to succeed each and every day. Audi Victoria is a growing, customer and employee focused dealership offering only the finest automobiles, accessories, and service. Audi Victoria now has a rare opportunity for Sales Manager.

Are you an experienced sales professional with an extreme passion for leading a fun and energetic team? Are you passionate about the automotive industry with a desire to help others discover the dream car they never knew they could own?  Do you lead by example, challenge others to be better than the status quo and dedicate yourself to the success of the team? Do you Inspire and motivate others to step out of their circle and meet new prospects in their everyday surroundings?  If you are a detail oriented, intuitive and forward thinking individual with a passion to drive sales and strive for results, we would love to meet you. 

A career within the GAIN Group means you’ll enjoy:

  • A great work life balance
  • Many growth opportunities for you to expand and develop your career
  • The best extended medical coverage within the industry including life insurance and disability
  • An opportunity to achieve the career your always hoped and dreamed for through hard work, dedication and following our specific training paths within the GAIN training Academy and respective brand training
  • Owning your “dream car” by participating in “drive your own brand” programs which allows all of our employees to understand the products in which they represent
  • Employee discounts at our Villa Eyrie Resort, Vancouver Island Motorsport Circuit and various dealerships
  • Being a part of a company that gives back to the community through sponsorships and donations to support arts, sports, motorsport, families in need, sick children, hospice and many other programs on Vancouver Island

Key Responsibilities:

  • Bring enthusiasm and fun to the team while still motivating, inspiring and maintaining a good structure and morale within the department
  • The ability to focus on every client coming to the dealership and insuring the sales team is following our sales process from start to finish until their needs are filled
  • Monitor and supervise the follow up process for every lead channel
  • Train, supervise and motivate the sales team to achieve benchmark sales performances and client satisfaction scores
  • Focus on every sales person to book at least 2 appointments for every day from prospecting activities scheduled by the manager
  • Lead by example, role play and encourage all sales people and F&I staff to follow prospecting, follow up and client relation processes.
  • Support the proven sales process that allows the client to purchase a vehicle in comfort and the team to achieve their goals in sales and F&I operations.
  • Ability to analyze, problem solve and provide positive solutions
  • Strong communication and writing skills
  • Monitor and establish a report for all lead sources received each month for each store – cross referencing with marketing channels, source of leads and compare with actual
  • Ensure compliance of brand standards from GAIN and the manufacturers we represent in everything you do
  • Participate in on-going training to further advance your abilities, knowledge and skills that may enhance our customer experience and presence within our markets
  • Adopt, implement and execute all standards, processes and procedures established by GAIN
  • Assist in the planning and execution of group events that will keep your customers engaged and loyal

Job Title: Receptionist- part time, permanent position

Department: Sales and Administrative

Reports To: Controller / Sales Manager

Job Description

SUMMARY

  1. Greets callers or walk in customers at the dealership, determines the nature of their business, and directs to appropriate destination.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Customer Service

  1. Greets customers and determines the nature of their visit in a friendly and professional manner.
  2. Communicate to sales coordinator/sales consultants the arrival of their license plates.

Process

  1. Directs customers to the correct department, notifies the appropriate person a customer is waiting, and introduces the customer to appropriate person.
  2. Answers quickly and tracks incoming phone calls. Directs caller to appropriate department or individual or takes a thorough message and communicates messages to the appropriate parties in a timely manner.
  3. Obtains basic demographic information about each customer, using an ups card, a log sheet, or other method established by the dealership.
  4. Enters data into prospect tracking system and runs prospect reports for managers weekly.
  5. Assist with stocking in new vehicles by making folders, stage, type vehicle or customer information into computer, printing cards, etc.

Department/Team

  1. Types memos, correspondence, reports, and other documents; provides clerical support as requested.

Housekeeping

  1. Maintains a professional appearance and neat work area. Performs other duties as assigned.

MINIMUM KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES

  1. Six months previous experience with multi line phones in fast paced environment preferred.
  2. Effective interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills and computer skills.
  3. Ability to add and subtract two-digit numbers and to multiply and divide by 10's and 100's.
  4. Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
  5. Fluency in Mandarin or Cantonese an asset but not a must.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

Job Purpose

This position is responsible for supervising the workshop with the objective of achieving a standard level of quality, efficiency and profitability. The Shop Foreman has direct supervision over the Licensed Technicians and Apprentice Technicians.

Core Accountabilities

  • Provide Technicians with instruction on repair procedures and contact the Manufacturer Technical Department as necessary.
  • Ensure that the Apprentice Technician training is proceeding as required.
  • Ensure that all Technicians are familiar with service bulletins, rules and safety matters.
  • Inform Service Consultants of additional work required and direct Technicians as required.
  • Approve work orders and ensure times allotted are not exceeded and that additional work is documented accurately on the work order.
  • Road test vehicles upon completion of work.
  • Ensure that time controls operate as prescribed by Management.
  • Ensure that general order in the workshop is maintained; including maintenance of special tools, equipment and service literature.
  • Maintain the accuracy of warranty work and that parts exchanged are returned for claim.
  • Advise Service Consultants and Technicians whether work is CP, warranty or internal.
  • Arrange emergency service coverage as specified by the Service Manager.

Requirements

  • Master Technician Qualification.
  • G Driver’s Licence.
  • Clear Driver’s Abstract.
  • Minimum of five years of automotive industry experience.
  • Excellent customer service skills.
  • Excellent communication skills both verbal and written.
  • Strong leadership skills.
  • Professional attitude.
  • Knowledge and use of power, machine and hand tools.
  • Extensive knowledge of different vehicles and their service needs.
  • Ability to operate electronic diagnostic equipment.
  • Ability to effectively communicate automotive issues clearly.
  • Ability to work independently or as a team, managing his or her time and work flow.
  • Ability to drive manual transmission vehicles.
  • Proficient with CDK and/or Reynolds systems, ability to operate PC based software.
  • Strong leadership skills.
  • Proven ability to influence change and effectively lead projects.
  • High School Diploma or equivalent.

Personal Attributes

  • Passion, motivation, focus and leadership skills.
  • Results focused approach.
  • Team player.
  • Strong communication skills: both written, verbal and listening.
  • Ability to influence, negotiate and mediate effectively.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality and professionalism.
  • Excellent interpersonal and team building skills.
  • Strong time management and organizational skills.
  • Honest, courteous and able to demonstrate strong work ethics.
  • Driven and ability to work with minimum supervision.

Working Conditions

  • Walking about the service department
  • Bending, stretching, lifting, climbing and reaching
  • Standing six to eight hours during a shift
  • Using physical and manual dexterity
  • Using computers to look up and enter data
  • Using equipment consistent with industry standards
  • Exposed to noise, vibrations, dust, exhaust fumes, and a variety of other hazardous and non-hazardous materials.

Responsible for the sales of all Pre-Owned vehicles, the profitability of the department and will assume responsibility for evaluating, purchasing, reconditioning, displaying and marketing the Pre-Owned vehicle inventory.

Core Accountabilities

  • Prepare monthly and annual department objectives for the sales, gross turnover and expenses of the Pre-Owned sales department.

  • Follow market trends as a basis for deciding which vehicles to stock.

  • Implement, and direct a turnover policy of 45 days.
  • Perform dealer trades as required.
  • Manage the Pre-Owned vehicles reconditioning procedures, ensuring that it doesn’t exceed forecasts.
  • Create and maintain a network of wholesale and retail Sales Consultants to whom we would purchase and sell vehicles.
  • Attend the vehicle auction as approved and required by the General Manager.
  • Closely monitor GP from auction purchases, and compare it to GP from trade-ins.
  • Develop and manage wholesale activities.
  • Direct and assist Sales Consultants in the setting of aggressive, but realistic, monthly objectives.
  • Provide the Sales Consultants with support.
  • Monitor Sales Consultant’s activities to ensure that we achieve high CSI results.
  • Encourage departmental team work.
  • Maintain good communications with the New Vehicle department, as well as other departments.

  • High school diploma or equivalent.
  • Automotive industry experience.
  • Minimum of 1 - 3 years of previous management experience in the automotive industry.
  • Valid Ontario G Driver’s Licence.
  • Clear Driver’s Abstract.

  • Strong business acumen.
  • Professional appearance.

  • Ability to sell the minimum quota according to dealership objective
  • Excellent communication skills: verbal and written.

Personal Attributes

  • Passion, motivation, focus and leadership skills.

job.detail:
NewRoads Chrysler, a part of the NewRoads Automotive Group, is hiring a Service Advisor. This is an outstanding opportunity to join a busy service department team with excellent earning potential.

Job responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Advise customers on the care of their cars and the value of maintaining their vehicles in accordance with manufacture's specifications, using maintenance menus.
  • Communicate the need for additional work when needed; explain the details to the customer, including the additional cost and time consideration and document properly on repair order.

  • Interpret warranty information and policies to customers.
  • Advise customers of parts ordered and make an appointment to have them installed before customer leaves.
  • Assist the service manager as necessary.

job.detail:
Downtown Automotive Group represents a number of the most recognized and respected brands in the automotive industry. Founded in 1992, our team has grown to more than 300 employees across our head office and 10 retail locations. DAG has been an active member of the downtown Toronto community from day one and we operate with the vision that people are our most important asset and the foundation of our success. Early next year, DAG will launch the first multi-branded, multi-purpose automotive/residential complex in downtown Toronto – The “Autoplex” – which will be the new home for seven Downtown brands: Ford, Genesis, Hyundai, Infiniti, Lincoln, Nissan, and Toyota. Lexus Downtown, Toyota on Front and Avenue Nissan are also proud members of DAG. It’s an exciting time for our company!

Our group has an immediate opening for the position of Service Advisor within our Downtown Toyota location (677 Queen Street East). At Downtown Toyota, we are dedicated to providing the ultimate customer experience. We are looking for a self-motivated team player with great communication skills. You have a positive attitude and a strong work ethic. You are friendly, organized, detail-oriented and have the ability to work in a fast-paced environment. You have a minimum of 3 years of customer service experience as well as a clean and valid driver’s license (you will be required to provide an abstract). If you love cars, that’s a bonus!

Reporting to the Service Manager, you will be responsible for providing exceptional front-line service for the department:

- Assisting customers with their vehicle service requirements.

- Responding to phone and email inquiries in a quick and efficient manner.

- Exceeding assigned sales targets.

Have you wanted to work in a coastal town where you can play just as hard as you work? If you’ve even thought about it then we’ve got the job for you. MacCarthy GM is a fast growing dealer in beautiful Prince Rupert and we need a Journeyman Technician.

We offer competitive tech rates, safety footwear allowance, life/medical/dental benefits, training, career advancement opportunities, management support...and much more.

We are located in busy and affluent Markham, surrounded by many neighbourhoods, office buildings and shopping malls.  Our state-of-the-art facility offers our customers convenience, great location and overall satisfaction. This makes us the dealership-of-choice in the surrounding area, with a loyal customer following, huge database for business development and customer retention, and high customer satisfaction scores.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Perform vehicle maintenance and repairs as assigned
  • Diagnose the source of any malfunctions and perform repair
  • Qualify all vehicles for warranty coverage prior to performing warranty repairs
  • Examine vehicles to determine if additional safety or service work is required
  • Perform road tests using safe driving standards

REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

  • Strong product knowledge
  • Strong aptitude of technical/mechanical repairs
  • Good time management skills
  • Organizational ability and attention to detail
  • Ideally, two (2) years minimum in technician position
  • One (1) year ACURA/HONDA product experience
  • General Dealership experience

We offer a great compensation package including a full benefit program, management support, team atmosphere, and training programs.

Dilawri Group of Companies is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status.

Downtown Automotive Group represents a number of the most recognized and respected brands in the automotive industry. Founded in 1992, our team has grown to more than 300 employees across our head office and 10 retail locations. DAG has been an active member of the downtown Toronto community from day one and we operate with the vision that people are our most important asset and the foundation of our success. Early next year, DAG will launch the first multi-branded, multi-purpose automotive/residential complex in downtown Toronto – The “Autoplex” – which will be the new home for seven Downtown brands: Ford, Genesis, Hyundai, Infiniti, Lincoln, Nissan, and Toyota. Lexus Downtown, Toyota on Front and Avenue Nissan are also proud members of DAG. It’s an exciting time for our company!

Our group has an immediate opening for the position of Service Advisor within our Infiniti/Nissan Downtown location. We are dedicated to providing the ultimate customer experience. We are looking for a self-motivated team player with great communication skills. You have a positive attitude and a strong work ethic. You are friendly, organized, detail-oriented and have the ability to work in a fast-paced environment. You have a minimum of 3 years of customer service experience as well as a clean and valid driver’s license (you will be required to provide an abstract). If you love cars, that’s a bonus!

What you will be doing:

Reporting to the Service Manager, you will be responsible for providing exceptional front-line service for the department:

- Assisting customers with their vehicle service requirements.

- Responding to phone and email inquiries in a quick and efficient manner.

- Applying a "customer first" and "fix it right the first time" mentality.

- Mediating and resolving customer problems and issues.

- Exceeding assigned sales targets.

- Meeting the Customer Satisfactory Index.

We offer a competitive compensation package including base salary and performance-based bonuses, medical/dental benefits, an employee purchase program, team atmosphere, management support and ongoing training, as well as opportunities for career development and advancement within the group.

DAG is committed to an inclusive and accessible workplace. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

As New Vehicle Support Staff, you play a very important supporting role in the New Car Sales Department by ensuring the showroom demonstrators are clean, all demonstrators and all other new car inventory are appropriately located. Assist in dealer trade deliveries (i.e. pick up and drop off)

Performs other related duties as required  by the New Vehicle Sales Manager

Valid class “G” Ontario Driver’s license
Clean Driving Abstract
No Criminal Record
Professional Appearance
Excellent communication skills
Knowledge of daily operations
Effective organizational skills
Ability to adjust to and work with teams
Ability to work under pressure
Able to work flexible hours nor extended hours
Able to lift heavy items (i.e. tires, rims & etc.)

We are looking for a passionate, motivated, and knowledgeable Controller at Koch Ford Lincoln Sales.

The candidate should have a firm grasp of the accounting concepts discussed below, as well as a commitment to excellence and a dedication to the growth of their own knowledge and the growth of the company.

The position combines an administrative role responsible for reporting, data entry, and application of general accounting principles, with a management role, responsible for managing an accounting department of 4-5 employees. The candidate must demonstrate exceptional capability for both the administrative and management sides of the role.

General tasks include (but are not limited to):

  • Manage the accounting operations by developing, monitoring and maintaining a system of controls over accounting transactions.
  • Responsible for hiring, training, mentoring and managing accounting functions providing daily support and assistance while ensuring timely and accurate recording of all accounting transactions within the accounting department
  • Provide direction and review of the payroll function including all payroll transactions and related reporting.
  • Maintain an organizational structure within the accounting department to facilitate the achievement of the department’s short-term goals and long-term objectives.
  • Prepare and submit monthly financial statements, ensuring that financial reports comply with current accounting principles and standards for ASPE and Ford Motor Company.
  • Work under the direction of the CFO to draft, implement, and monitor policy and procedure for all dealership departments.
  • Complete daily bank reconciliations, bank account management and submission of wire transfers when needed.
  • Comply with all local, provincial and federal filings and reporting requirements ensuring all regulated remittances (GST, corporate tax, payroll tax, etc.) are accurate and paid on time.
  • Monthly reconciliation and verification of all accounting schedules.
  • Oversee and maintain an orderly accounting filing system and a comprehensive system of accounting records.
  • Full management and certification of the accounting for and in-house lease department. Includes the auditing, preparation, and posting of in-house lease deals, terminations, and extensions
  • Coordinate the provision and analysis of information to external auditors for a yearly review procedure.
  • Provide direction and support to department managers on established policy and procedure.  Discuss and suggest resolutions for departmental issues and assist with training of dealership staff outside of the accounting department when required.

 

The ideal candidate for the position:

  • Possesses a strong grasp of accounting policies and procedures.
  • Previous dealership accounting experience.
  • Is self-motivated, detail-oriented and highly organized.
  • Ability to multitask while working effectively and constructively within a dealership environment.
  • A team player dedicated and willing to go the extra mile whenever possible.
  • Is able to deliver accurate, detailed information under strict deadlines.
  • Lead, mentor and create a strong, cohesive and cross-trained accounting team that fosters an environment that promotes co-operation, learning, positivity, enjoyment, and respect.
  • Has a high degree of emotional intelligence and is able to effectively defuse and manage conflict.  Exceptionally handles high-stress and high-pressure situations.
  • An accounting designation (CPA, etc.) is helpful but is not required.

 

What we offer as an employer:

Koch Ford Lincoln Sales is an automotive dealership that was established over 50 years ago in Edmonton, Alberta. Throughout our history, we have continued to combine outstanding customer service and a fantastic work environment to create a simple and honest car buying experience. We are a family-owned and operated business, with an ownership group that is hands-on and active in the day-to-day operations of the company.

We aim to be as committed to your growth as an employee as you are to our company. We have a management team that encourages openness, honesty, communication, and respect for all employees. We are a passionate, results-driven business that is an innovator in the automotive sphere. We are always looking for ways to improve our business, and encourage our employees to contribute to this growth, bettering themselves and the company in the process.

Sous la direction de l'adjointe contrôleur, votre responsabilité consistera à agir à titre d'agent de support au département de la comptabilité

  • Coder, totaliser, réunir en lots, consigner dans un registre ou saisir à l'ordinateur, et vérifier et rapprocher des transactions, telles que les comptes fournisseurs et clients, la paie, les commandes, les chèques, les factures, les demandes de chèques et les relevés bancaires;

  • Effectuer d'autres tâches de bureau connexes, telles que le traitement de texte, la tenue de dossiers et du classement, les envois par télécopieur et les photocopies.

Kia of Brampton is currently seeking a highly motivated Licensed Automotive Technician with a proven track record to join their dynamic team! The successful candidate will be passionate about automotive repair, have their 310s certification, and a team player! They will be responsible for inspecting and diagnosing problems, providing repairs and maintenance to all types of new and used vehicles, and seen as a point of support and leadership for Apprentice Technicians.

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities

  • Project a positive attitude for the benefit of our customers and our junior employees.
  • Retrieve repair orders from dispatch on a timely basis.
  • Obtain parts from the Parts Department as required.
  • Use repair order punch clock appropriately, (i.e. punch onto specific line when starting task, and punch off when task is complete).
  • Road test vehicles as required.
  • Address all customer concerns using the Three C’s method – Complaint, Cause, Correction.
  • Examine all vehicles to determine if additional safety or service work is required.
  • Prepare a complete report on the back of the repair order.
  • Estimate flat rate times for each recommendation. Use supplied flat-rate manuals and the Employer policies as a guide.
  • Obtain parts prices and note availability for each recommendation.
  • Perform all work as outlined on the front of the repair order and as authorized on the back, with efficiency and accuracy, and in accordance with company and factory standards.
  • Order all parts when authorization is received, unless specifically told otherwise. Indicate on the RO that you have done so.
  • Save and tag parts if the job is under warranty or insurance, or if requested by the customer.
  • Road-test vehicles after service any time a wheel is removed, or any time a repair that might affect drivability is performed (i.e. tune-up, valve adjustment, brake work, suspension work, rattle/noise repair, etc.). Straight oil changes or transmission fluid changes are excluded.
  • Ensure that all work performed is thorough, accurate, and completed in a timely fashion.
  • Work effectively without supervision.
  • Supervise work of all apprentice technicians or students; report immediately any deficiencies to the Service Manager.
  • Attend factory-sponsored training classes as scheduled by management.
  • Attend dealer-specified training courses as scheduled by management.
  • Keep abreast of all factory technical bulletins.
  • Learn and understand all current and emerging technologies as they apply to automobile service.
  • Maintain a high degree of concentration to prevent “comebacks”.
  • Ensure that customer cars are kept as clean or cleaner than when they arrived, both inside and out.
  • Keep shop area neat and clean at all times.
  • Clean bay and bench at the end of each shift.
  • Dispose of garbage, recycling, etc. as required.
  • Understand and follow federal, provincial, and local regulations, such as those governing the disposal of hazardous wastes.
  • Work in strict compliance with the Laws of the Province of Ontario and Canada including, but not limited to, the Employment Standards Act (ESA) and the Accessibilities for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA).
  • Understand and comply with all federal, provincial and local regulations that affect service operations, such as the Occupational Health and Safety Act (OHSA), waste disposal regulations, etc.
  • Other duties as required by management.

Skills and Qualifications

  • Grade 12 diploma or GED.
  • Automotive Service Technician, fully licensed (310S or higher).
  • Proven knowledge and experience with automotive mechanical operations.
  • Must be team oriented with a positive attitude.
  • Work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
  • Must be reliable and able to work productively with minimal supervision.
  • Ability to read and comprehends instructions and information.
  • Possesses valid driver's license and a good driving record.
  • Has a neat appearance, good judgment, and mature attitude.
  • Personable, reliable, courteous.
  • Works well in a fast paced environment.
  • Demonstrate willingness to learn and succeed.
  • Must be team oriented, reliable and hardworking with a positive attitude.
  • Excellent diagnostic and electrical skills.
  • Read, understand, and adhere to all rules, regulations and procedures as required by the Employer.
  • Obey the laws at all times, including the Occupational Health and Safety Act (OHSA), and the Highway Traffic Act.
  • Must have valid Class ‘G’ Ontario driver's license and clean drivers abstract.

Kia of Brampton offers:

  • Great management support.
  • Comprehensive training provided.
  • Health, Dental and Vision Insurance after 3 months.

job.detail:
CONTROLLER – Luxury dealership - North GTA

The ideal candidate shall have at least 3-5 years of retail automotive financial accounting management experience preferably with a degree or diploma in Accounting or Business studies. However, educational and/or professional accounting designations can be waived for appropriate working knowledge and experience. We are also willing to consider candidates at the Assistant Controller / Office Manager level who can be groomed for a more senior role within the near future. 

We are looking for someone who is well organized, detail oriented, articulate, professional and a team player, with a passion for the business.  Someone who has a ‘gate-keeper’ mentality and be capable of thinking outside of the box, who not afraid to ask questions regarding expenses and/or payable requests.  Integrity, decency and professional deportment are key personal traits that are strongly desired.  

Reporting to the General Manager, and indirectly to the owner, as the Controller of this high-volume luxury dealership, you will be responsible for coordinating, maintaining and controlling all financial activities providing leadership and direction to accounting staff, and ensuring timely financial information to senior management.  This dealership is a crown jewel within a well-established and highly respected dealer group that has a reputation for treating employees at all levels with respect and encouragement to excel and do well.

Ideally, your qualifications shall include:

a minimum of 5years financial management experience within a retail automotive dealership with a thorough knowledge of financial and accounting practices & procedures as a controller or assistant controller
ability to prepare a complete financial statement monthly according to guidelines and the manufacturer's format and time frame
an understanding of governmental regulations and reporting requirements
expertise with financial management software such as Reynolds & Reynolds and/or CDK and 180 software.
ability to provide a timely daily operating control (DOC) and keeping the Owner/General Manager informed about trends, bank balances, inventory positions, payables, sales volumes, maintaining an effective cash management system etc.
ability to effectively hire, trains, and provide leadership and encouragement to office personnel.

Our client offers a stimulating, team oriented environment where you will be challenged, encouraged and rewarded in the pursuit of excellence within a supportive, progressive organization.  Flextime, family values and professional development are all key values offered and respected by this equal opportunity employer.

An attractive salary and bonus compensation, car allowance or demo along with comprehensive employee benefits is offered. 

To investigate this opportunity confidentially, please forward your resume ASAP to Clive Crowe, CEO, Cromark International (providing effective employment solutions to the automotive community since 1975).  You may also us at 416-410-7575

Are you a highly motivated, dedicated and driven individual? If you answered yes to all three, then you are the right person to join our team as an Automotive Sales Consultant with Toyota On The Park!

As a Sales Consultant, a typical day might include the following:

  • Provide customers with information regarding vehicles for sale
  • Complete sales of automobiles while offering additional products and/or services
  • Conduct test drives of vehicles for sale
  • Overcome objections of prospective customers.
  • Emphasize product/service features and benefits, quote prices, discuss credit terms, and prepare sales order forms and/or reports.
  • Build and foster a network of referrals to create new opportunities for revenue growth.
  • Always maintain professionalism, tact, diplomacy, and sensitivity to portray the company in a positive manner.
  • Use marketing data using applicable sales management software tools to maximize sales efficiency and effectiveness.
  • Maintain accurate records, including sales reports, expense reimbursement forms, billing invoices, and other documentation.
  • Update job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities
  • Build and maintain ongoing awareness of new products and services, competitor activities, and other research.
  • Performs other duties as required.

This job might be right for you if:

You have a minimum 3 years of direct work experience in a sales position and have demonstrated the ability to convert prospects and close deals while maintaining the established sales quotas.

You have obtained your OMVIC certification in addition to a valid driver’s license.

You are self-motivated and driven. You volunteer for new challenges and responsibilities, all while maintaining high energy and an engaging level of enthusiasm.

You have a passion for customer service. You use your strong communication skills to develop buyers by building and maintaining rapport with customers.

Compensation

  • Offer a Competitive Compensation Structure with the ability to earn between $60,000-$90,000+
  • Group Benefit Plan after three months of employment
  • A monthly car allowances

If you think you are the right candidate for the job, please submit your resume! For more information, please check out our website www.toyotaonthepark.ca or you can stop by the dealership to talk to one of our managers! We look forward to hearing from you.

In accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities, a request for accommodation will be accepted throughout the hiring process.

We are an equal opportunity employer that welcomes all applicants including persons with disabilities, visible minorities, women, and aboriginals. We thank you for your interest, however, only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

Downtown Automotive Group represents a number of the most recognized and respected brands in the automotive industry. Founded in 1992, our team has grown to more than 350 employees across our head office and 10 retail locations. DAG has been an active member of the downtown Toronto community from day one and we operate with the vision that people are our most important asset and the foundation of our success. Early next year, DAG will launch the first multi-branded, multi-purpose automotive/residential complex in downtown Toronto – The “Autoplex” – which will be the new home for seven Downtown brands: Ford, Genesis, Hyundai, Infiniti, Lincoln, Nissan, and Toyota. Lexus Downtown, Toyota on Front and Avenue Nissan are also proud members of DAG. It’s an exciting time for our company!

At Downtown Toyota, we have a very busy, growing service department and are looking for an Technicians (both Licensed and 3rd/4th year Apprentice) to join our fast paced, customer-oriented facility at 677 Queen Street East. The ideal candidates will have the following:

- Ontario Mechanic's License (310S) in good standing (for Licensed Techs).

- Proven record of quality and efficient workmanship.

- Ability to work as part of a high performance team.

- Positive attitude with a drive to succeed.

- Strong commitment to customer satisfaction.

- Strong aptitude of technical/mechanical repairs.

- Good computer and time management skills.

- Organizational ability and attention to detail.

- A valid driver's license (with clean abstract).

If you are able to deliver strong customer satisfaction consistently, are motivated and a great teammate, we are interested in speaking with you. We offer a competitive compensation package including medical/dental benefits, an employee purchase program, team atmosphere, management support and ongoing training, as well as opportunities for career development and advancement within the group.

DAG is committed to an inclusive and accessible workplace. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Capital Hyundai’s dedicated Service Centre is there to help our customers preserve their purchase and keep their vehicle running properly. We are looking for a candidate who will represent our brand image and will provide a positive customer experience to all our customers that are in for servicing.

As a Service Advisor, you’ll provide excellent service, with a goal to serve and maintain great relationships with our clients. The primary function of the position is to initiate automotive repairs and services by establishing performance problems and services requested; verifying warranty and service contract coverage; developing estimates; writing repair orders; maintaining records, while having a strong commitment to customer satisfaction. Other requirements include:

  • Confirms warranty and service contract coverage by examining customer records and papers; explaining provisions and exclusions.
  • Develops estimates by costing materials, supplies, and labor; calculating customer's payment, including deductibles if applicable.
  • Assists with the coordination of alternate transportation such as rental car reservations or shuttle service.
  • Responsible for greeting customers, listening to requests, scheduling appointments, and estimating costs.
  • Work with customers to determine problems with a vehicle and provide technicians with accurate repair descriptions.
  • Contact the customer to obtain authorization for repairs, making sure to first address the customer’s main concerns before up-selling other repairs that have been suggested by the Technician; as well as to notify them that the repairs are completed and their vehicle is ready for pick-up.
  • Receive payment for the work completed, handle the cash or credit transaction and ensure customer satisfaction.

Qualifications & Experience

  • High School Diploma or equivalent.
  • 1+ years’ experience in the automotive industry or auto tech is a MUST.
  • Certificate of Conduct is required.
  • Proficiency with computers and technology; experience with CDK software preferred.

Benefits

  • Commission - you have the ability to earn extra $ on top of the hourly salary.
  • Group Insurance Benefits
  • Registered Pension Plan

**Subject to the terms and conditions of company policies.**

If you have the drive and a passion for customer service and obtain the needed experience, forward your resume today!

Capital Auto Group is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to fostering a workforce in each of our locations that reflects the diversity of the community in which we perform business. We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
